summary: Pitru Paksha is a special 16-day period in the Hindu calendar when people remember and honor their ancestors. During this time, Hindus perform rituals called Shraddha or Tarpana, often involving food offerings. It is considered an important time to show respect to those who have passed away. The period usually takes place in the month of Bhadrapada (September) after Ganesh Utsav. People believe that the souls of their ancestors visit earth during this time.
title: Pitru Paksha
